paragraph: Mark Potsic, better known by his stage name DJ Nu-Mark (born June 10, 1971), is an American hip hop producer and DJ. He is a member of Jurassic 5, as well as the owner of Hot Plate Records. He has collaborated with and produced for a variety of artists across different genres, including J-Live, Aloe Blacc, Charles Bradley, and Bumpy Knuckles, among others. In 2004, the Hands On mixtape was released on Sequence Records. In 2012, DJ Nu-Mark released the album titled Broken Sunlight on Hot Plate Records. In 2014, Slimkid3 & DJ Nu-Mark, his collaborative album with Slimkid3, was released on Delicious Vinyl.
Blend Crafters Volume One (2004, with Pomo)
"I Know, Didn't I" b/w "No Pity Party" (2014, with Slimkid3)
J-Live – "The Zone" from Then What Happened? (2008)
Hilltop Hoods – "Classic Example" from State of the Art (2009)
Chali 2na – "Comin' Thru" and "Graff Time" from Fish Outta Water (2009)
The Lonely Island – "The Old Saloon" and "Punch You in the Jeans" from Incredibad (2009)
The Lonely Island – "Rocky" from Turtleneck & Chain (2011)
The Lonely Island – "Spell It Out" and "I Don't Give a Honk" from The Wack Album (2013)
